frontmatter.name: Aadhitya Amarendiran
frontmatter.bio: A student and a guy who loves to learn and develop some stuff. I'm a type who thinks that learning is a never-ending job. I'd pretty much listen to Music and play some games while I'm not intensely working.

frontmatter.name: Abishek Kumar
frontmatter.bio: A Software Engineer and a technology aspirant, trying to learn and improve the way to architect a software design.

frontmatter.name: Aditi Ahuja
frontmatter.bio: Aditi Ahuja is Student developer from Bangalore, India. Passionate about venturing into newer, niche fields. Open to challenges and opportunities, both technical or otherwise.

frontmatter.name: Aisuko Li
frontmatter.bio: I am a software engineer. Previously at Rancher Labs, currently I am a Layer5 maintainer, responsible for Meshery adapters and Helm charts across the Layer5 organization. Intrigued by Quantum Computing, I currently study at RMIT.

frontmatter.name: Alonso Lopez
frontmatter.bio: I have been a faculty member in IT Engineer programs, since I joined Hermosillo’s Tech University almost 20 years ago. Mainly teaching and getting involved in academic events and activities, also making bonds up close with local and regional IT organizations. In 2016, I founded an academic IT group, for which I am the main coordinator, to develop various projects and collaborations that will benefit our IT programs. Besides being prototyping and developing solutions, I’ve been helping and advising organizations of my local market. But one of my most cherished milestones has been contributing with Layer5’s Meshery, in which I‘ve been involving with the most welcoming community and the greatest talented people I know. Also I’m a professional cellist for about 20 years, playing cello in my state orchestra, and several ensembles. I had the honor of premiering “Ceremonial” (feb. 2020) by composer T. Hori, and "Fantasía Num.1 para violoncello” (dec. 2018) by composer A. Vega. So I’m also passioned about multimedia, arts, entrepreneurship, creative work, video, film and animation.

frontmatter.name: Anand Kumar Singh
frontmatter.bio: I am currently a Software Quality Engineer at Red Hat, completed Computer Science Engineering from UEM Jaipur. I have experience on devops, CI, Quality analysis and  more. I also like FPS games,  contribute to open-source and do certifications.

frontmatter.name: Anirudh Jain
frontmatter.bio: I am a software engineer diversing on all part of the stack, eager to learn anything new I find and get on with improving my skills to fix up solutions for real world problems. I spent most of my time learning and contributing to open source. Always happy to meet new people.

frontmatter.name: Ashish Tiwari
frontmatter.bio: I am a final year computer science undergraduate at IP University, Delhi. Passionate Backend Developer with an interest in microservices and cloud-native ecosystems. Constantly learning new things based on interest & curiosity and trying to give back as much in open-source. Other than that, I love solving algorithm problems. A side note about me would be that, once upon a time, I fell in love with mathematics and physics, which still is an ongoing affair.

frontmatter.name: Dev Kalra
frontmatter.bio: I am a computer science student who is always looking for opportunities to learn something new and grow. I like solving challenging problems which can help exercise some brain muscles otherwise it is boring, and I will procrastinate.

frontmatter.name: Dhruv Patel
frontmatter.bio: Hey there. I am Dhruv, a computer science major from Indian Institute of Technology, Jodhpur. I am passionate about software development, computer-science and opensource development. I look forward on continuing discovering new technologies and learn from every opportunity I get.

frontmatter.name: Hussaina Begum
frontmatter.bio: I am a Staff Engineer at VMware, systems and network security are my areas of  interest. I have worked on IBM's AIX, Citrix's Netscaler, Cisco's Catalyst Switches before. I am currently working on VMware's NSXT product. I spend my weekends either running, trekking or learning new technologies.

frontmatter.name: Lee Calcote
frontmatter.bio: Lee Calcote is an innovative product and technology leader, passionate about empowering engineers and enabling organizations. As Founder of Layer5, he is at the forefront of the cloud native movement. Open source, advanced and emerging technologies have been a consistent focus through Calcote’s time at SolarWinds, Seagate, Cisco and Schneider Electric. An advisor, author, and speaker, Calcote is active in the community as a Docker Captain, Cloud Native Ambassador and GSoC, GSoD, and CommunityBridge Mentor.

frontmatter.name: Michael Gfeller
frontmatter.bio: I’ve been working as an infrastructure and software engineer for over 20 years, both as technical architect and developer. It started with IT infrastructure and continued with Java-based enterprise applications. In recent years, my focus shifted to cloud architecture, DevOps and modern software development. In modern distributed architectures, I find services meshes especially fascinating. There, simplicity handles complexity. I started to program around 1980 and have used many programming languages since then. My favorite languages are Clojure and PostScript.

frontmatter.name: Navendu Pottekkat
frontmatter.bio: I'm working on open-source projects in Deep Learning, Web Development and Cloud-Native Development. My research interests are in memristive systems and computer vision. Coding all day, everyday!

frontmatter.name: Nikhil Ladha
frontmatter.bio: I am a CS Enginner, currently working as an ASE at Red Hat. A Maintainer, MeshMate  at Layer5. Also, like to explore and learn about front-end technologies and have gained some good expereince in it by contributing to OSS. Like to contribute to this open-source world and guide others to contribute and grow in their life in the best way possible.

frontmatter.name: Nuno do Carmo
frontmatter.bio: During the day, I'm a Global Learning Management System Administrator and Trainer for a pharma company based in Switzerland. Outside work, I'm a Cloud Native passionate with a “twist” everything I do or test, is from Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL). After years of blogging and helping the community, this year I've been nominated Docker Captain, CNCF Ambassador and dual Microsoft MVP.

frontmatter.name: Piyush Singariya
frontmatter.bio: A Software Engineer from Bikaner, India. Passionate about Anime and solving impactful problems. Open to challenges and opportunities!

frontmatter.name: Rodolfo Martinez Vega
frontmatter.bio: I'm a software developer and a Linux lover. I like to participate in innovative projects in a startup environment. I'm interested in personal finances and how we can use it to reach our goals.

frontmatter.name: Rudraksh Pareek
frontmatter.bio: I'm an undergrad from India studying Computer Science and Engineering. I like to explore systems and networking and have a keen interest in working on cloud native technologies. I love learning by working on open source software and getting involved with the awesome communities around it.

frontmatter.name: Sayantan Bose
frontmatter.bio: A pre-final year student from Narula Institute of Technology, who is digging his way into the vast world of programming. I had joined Layer5 on May 2021 to put my hands into open-source and it has opened a wide world in front of me that had all the right things to upskill my knowledge and had helped me to be the best version of myself !!

frontmatter.name: Subham Rai
frontmatter.bio: Hi, I'm Subham Kumar Rai Associate Software Engineer at Red Hat and computer science graduate. I'm interested in open source and try to contribute as much as I can. I'm contributing to open source since my college times and Layer5 is my first project. And I believe contributing to open source is one of the best ways to learn. Thank you.

frontmatter.name: Utkarsh Srivastava
frontmatter.bio: I am an undergraduate student at IP University majoring in Computer Science and Engineering. I am a curiosity driven developer having special interest in distributed systems. Co-founded Hackstrap Technologies to power networking, partnerships and sales at scale. Learnt everything from open source, trying to give back as much as possible.

frontmatter.name: Vijay Cherukuri
frontmatter.bio: Born and raised in India. Went to graduate school in Michigan, Worked at ED/GM in the areas of CAD/CAM/CAE. Worked on other projects including at Cisco in Lee Calcote's group. Currently working on factory automation and plant support for a tire manufacturer.
